concept.title: RNG: Coding requirements for expansion modules
concept.shortdesc: An expansion module defines the expanded configuration for a map or topic element type.

section.p: Expansion modules are implemented by importing the expansion modules into a document-type shell in place of the vocabulary module that the expansion module modifies. The expansion module itself imports the vocabulary module to be expanded; within the import, the module redefines the patterns as needed to implement the expansion.

div.p: For example, an expansion module that modifies the content model of section imports the base module topicMod.rng. Within that import, it expands the section.content pattern:
div.codeblock: CONTENT MODEL AND ATTRIBUTE LIST OVERRIDES
div.p: Note that the specialized element sectionDesc must be declared in an element domain module that also is integrated into the document-type shell.
